Configuration File

As described in the Usage section, FortifyBugTrackerUtility requires a configuration file in order to do any work. FortifyBugTrackerUtility comes with example configuration files for the various combinations of source and target systems; you can modify these example configuration files according to your needs.

In general, a configuration file contains the following elements (you can click on each element to see a more detailed description):

  • A <beans> element that wraps all other configuration elements.
  • A <context:component-scan> element for loading source and target implementations.
  • A <util:map id="cliOptionsDefaultValues"> for setting default values for command line options.
  • An optional bean for selecting FoD application releases/SSC application versions to be processed, and mapping these to CLI option values:
    • FoD releases: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.src.fod.config.FoDSourceReleasesConfiguration">
    • SSC application versions: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.src.ssc.config.SSCSourceApplicationVersionsConfiguration">
  • A bean describing the FoD/SSC vulnerability configuration (vulnerability selection and filtering criteria, how to store target issue data in FoD/SSC, …):
    • FoD vulnerabilities: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.src.fod.config.FoDSourceVulnerabilitiesConfiguration">
    • SSC vulnerabilities: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.src.ssc.config.SSCSourceVulnerabilitiesConfiguration">
  • A bean describing the configuration of the target system (bug tracker, risk management system, file, …):
    • RSA Archer: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.archer.config.ArcherTargetConfiguration">
    • CSV File: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.file.config.FileTargetConfiguration">
    • Atlassian Jira: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.jira.config.JiraTargetConfiguration">
    • ALM Octane: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.octane.config.OctaneTargetConfiguration">
    • Azure DevOps: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.ado.config.ADOTargetConfiguration">
    • Native SSC bug tracker: <bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.ssc.config.SSCTargetConfiguration">
